definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: I believe someone else suggested it would make a good doormat.
sentences.chinese: 也許會有人說不如把它放在門口做個地墊。

sentences.english: He who does good comes to the temple gate, he who loves reaches the shrine.
sentences.chinese: 行善的人來到廟門口，兼愛的人走進大殿堂。

sentences.english: Information desk is at the gate, you can make a ask there.
sentences.chinese: 諮詢臺在門口，你可以去那裏問問。

sentences.english: Standing there in the office, miserable, I wanted to vanish into the paneling.
sentences.chinese: 我傷心地站在辦公室門口，恨不得消失在門縫裏。

sentences.english: Four gossips were chatting in a doorway.
sentences.chinese: 四個老婆子聚在一家大門口聊天。

sentences.english: One stewardess stands at the front cabin door to welcome the Passengers aboard.
sentences.chinese: 一位女乘務員站在機艙門口歡迎乘客登機。

sentences.english: My spirit and soul, keep waiting in your heart the door.
sentences.chinese: 我的靈和魂魄，不停守候在妳心門口。

sentences.english: Mao Shouliang quietly sneaked into the brothel, he saw Mr Broadband man at the door.
sentences.chinese: 毛壽良悄悄溜入青樓，他看到馮正寬帶人在門口。

sentences.english: The boy will bring you the keys at the door.
sentences.chinese: 茶房會在門口把鑰匙交給你的。

sentences.english: Hanging a gourd on the wall next to your front door is thought to bring wealth and fortune.
sentences.chinese: 在大門口旁可以掛上一個葫蘆，一般認爲可招財納福。

sentences.english: The first time I had seen her was in the Place de la Bourse, outside Susse's.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次是在交易所廣場絮斯商店門口遇到她的。

sentences.english: The system is controlled from a board fixed next to the chute door.
sentences.chinese: 該系統由垃圾道門口旁邊的一個面板來控制。

sentences.english: Albertha, watching from the doorway, cried out and ran to stop him.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾韋塔在門口看到後，呼喊着跑去阻止祖父。

sentences.english: As the car drove up to the door, he flew out to meet his son.
sentences.chinese: 當車子開到門口時，他飛也似地衝出去接他兒子。

sentences.english: We will mee at the school gate at 7 o’clock tomorrow morning
sentences.chinese: 我們明天早上七點鐘在學校大門口見。

sentences.english: You know that angel in the gate custody fight is the most outrageous of?
sentences.chinese: 你們可知道，監護天使在城門口打架是最不像話的？

definition: to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
variant of 這裡|这里[zhe4 li3]
(sitting) opposite/across (the street)/directly in front/to be face to face
the back door/fig. under the counter (indirect way for influence or pressure)/anus
